title: Luffy Will Restore Chinjao's Drill Head
theoryText: Based on the reveal that Garp flattened Chinjao's drill-shaped head 30 years ago, fans theorized that Luffy would eventually restore it during their battle. Since Garp broke it with a punch, a powerful enough punch from his grandson could potentially restore it to its original shape. This would turn Chinjao from an enemy into an ally, as Luffy would be undoing the damage his grandfather caused.
author: Multiple fans on forums and blogs
statusNote: This theory was confirmed in episode 649 when Luffy's punch restored Chinjao's drill head.

title: Chinjao Will Become Luffy's Ally
theoryText: After learning about Chinjao's grudge against Garp and his inability to access his treasure due to his flattened head, fans theorized that if Luffy could restore Chinjao's head, the legendary pirate would become grateful and join Luffy's cause. This would add a powerful ally with knowledge of the old era and connections to Kano Country.
author: One Piece community discussions
statusNote: This theory was confirmed later in the Dressrosa arc when Chinjao and the Happo Navy joined the Straw Hat Grand Fleet.

title: Hasshoken is Related to Advanced Armament Haki
theoryText: The introduction of Hasshoken martial arts, which uses vibrations to create shockwaves, led some fans to theorize that this technique might be an early form or precursor to Advanced Armament Haki. Both involve manipulating energy through the body to create internal damage, suggesting a potential connection between martial arts techniques and Haki development.
author: One Piece power system analysts
statusNote: While both techniques involve internal damage, the series hasn't explicitly confirmed a direct connection between Hasshoken and Advanced Armament Haki.

title: Jake Jake no Mi Could Be Used on Inanimate Objects
theoryText: After seeing Kelly Funk's Jake Jake no Mi ability to become a jacket worn by his brother, some fans speculated whether the fruit could be used on inanimate objects or large creatures, potentially allowing for creative combat applications beyond human hosts. This could make the fruit more versatile than initially shown.
author: Devil Fruit speculation community
statusNote: The full potential and limitations of the Jake Jake no Mi have not been thoroughly explored in the series.

title: Garp's Training to Fight Chinjao Foreshadows Luffy's Training Methods
theoryText: Chinjao's revelation that Garp destroyed eight mountains during training to face him parallels Luffy's extreme training methods. Fans theorized this shows a generational pattern in the Monkey D. family of using intense, destructive training to overcome powerful opponents, foreshadowing Luffy's future training arcs.
author: One Piece character analysis community
statusNote: Luffy's subsequent training arcs do show similarly extreme methods, though not explicitly connected to Garp's example.
